New Records: Rilee Rossouw became the first South African batter to score a century in T20 World Cup.
Rilee Rossouw became the second batter in history to score consecutive centuries in T20Is.
Rilee Rossouw equaled David Miller's record of two centuries in T20 internationals for South Africa.
Key Match Events: Rilee Rossouw smashed a century to help South Africa reach a score of 205 runs.
Quinton de Kock and Rilee Rossouw formed a 168-run partnership off just 85 balls.
Quinton de Kock scored a half-century.
South Africa's bowlers aimed to restrict Bangladesh to a low score after setting a target of 205 runs.
